Articles.Content:
Hi.

I landed an asteroid and I was thinking on putting it "on exhibition" outside some building at the KSC. My question is, will it persist there if no control-type part is attached to it? I'd hate it if the thing disappeared after a while.

Thanks.

Edited April 20, 2014 by Rosco P. Coltrane

It should stay put. Probably. I've had an untouched Class B in solar orbit for the last 36 Kerbal years and it's still in the tracking list.

If in doubt, make a pedestal for it with a probe core integrated in the design

Hi.

I landed an asteroid and I was thinking on putting it "on exhibition" outside some building at the KSC. My question is, will it persist there if no control-type part is attached to it? I'd hate it if the thing disappeared after a while.

Thanks.

If it is landed it will persist. The auto-delete Feature is only for things that are uncontrolled, not landed (Or splashed) and below 22km.

hehehehe. Perfect.

BTW, the new RGB lights are great!

hehehehe. Perfect.

BTW, the new RGB lights are great!

Oooh! Nice!

Take +1 for yourself. Heck, make that +5

What? How the heck did you catch that? Everyone knows Roscoe couldn't catch anything!

j/k
The typical, a bridge was down or there was a maintenance going on in the middle of the road. You know, sometimes they just can't jump it.
